newsitem.title: MACEDONIA: Macedonia makes a mint from mushrooms.
newsitem.headline: Macedonia makes a mint from mushrooms.

text.p: Mushrooms accounted for nearly half of Macedonia's agricultural export earnings last year, earning a cool $23 million for the Balkan nation.
Kiro Dokuzovski, head of the Macedonian Chamber of Commerce's agricultural sector, told Reuters mushrooms were turning into a strong earner.

"This figure should not be underestimated since it is almost double the mushroom export earnings in 1994 and since the overall profits from exports of all other agricultural products barely reaches $30 million," said Dokuzovski.
The bulk of the exports, or $17 million worth, went to Italy, followed by Germany, France and Switzerland.
